verses.text: Should a wise man utter vain knowledge, and fill his belly with the east wind?
Should he reason with unprofitable talk? or with speeches wherewith he can do no good?
Yea, thou castest off fear, and restrainest prayer before God.

similars.text: Then shalt thou understand the fear of the Lord, and find the knowledge of God.
Thou shalt fear the Lord thy God, and serve him, and shalt swear by his name.
Wherefore now let the fear of the Lord be upon you; take heed and do it: for there is no iniquity with the Lord our God, nor respect of persons, nor taking of gifts.
Ye shall not therefore oppress one another; but thou shalt fear thy God: for I am the Lord your God.
Hear my voice, O God, in my prayer: preserve my life from fear of the enemy.
Thou shalt fear the Lord thy God; him shalt thou serve, and to him shalt thou cleave, and swear by his name.
Thou shalt not be afraid of them: but shalt well remember what the Lord thy God did unto Pharaoh, and unto all Egypt;
Keep not thou silence, O God: hold not thy peace, and be not still, O God.
Thou shalt not rule over him with rigour; but shalt fear thy God.
The fear of the Lord is the instruction of wisdom; and before honour is humility.

verses.text: For thy mouth uttereth thine iniquity, and thou choosest the tongue of the crafty.

similars.text: Thou lovest all devouring words, O thou deceitful tongue.
Thy tongue deviseth mischiefs; like a sharp razor, working deceitfully.
The tongue of the wise useth knowledge aright: but the mouth of fools poureth out foolishness.
Thou givest thy mouth to evil, and thy tongue frameth deceit.
Thou givest thy mouth to evil, and thy tongue frameth deceit.
Thou art snared with the words of thy mouth, thou art taken with the words of thy mouth.
For your hands are defiled with blood, and your fingers with iniquity; your lips have spoken lies, your tongue hath muttered perverseness.

verses.text: Thine own mouth condemneth thee, and not I: yea, thine own lips testify against thee.

similars.text: For behold, have I testified against your law? Ye do not understand; ye say that I have spoken against your law; but I have not, but I have spoken in favor of your law, to your condemnation.
Thou givest thy mouth to evil, and thy tongue frameth deceit.
The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable: but the mouth of the wicked speaketh frowardness.
If I justify myself, mine own mouth shall condemn me: if I say, I am perfect, it shall also prove me perverse.
For my mouth shall speak truth; and wickedness is an abomination to my lips.
Against whom do ye sport yourselves? against whom make ye a wide mouth, and draw out the tongue? are ye not children of transgression, a seed of falsehood,
O my people, what have I done unto thee? and wherein have I wearied thee? testify against me.
He that keepeth his mouth keepeth his life: but he that openeth wide his lips shall have destruction.
My lips shall not speak wickedness, nor my tongue utter deceit.
Be not a witness against thy neighbour without cause; and deceive not with thy lips.
For they speak against thee wickedly, and thine enemies take thy name in vain.
For the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of the deceitful are opened against me: they have spoken against me with a lying tongue.

verses.text: Art thou the first man that was born? or wast thou made before the hills?

similars.text: Before the mountains were settled, before the hills was I brought forth:

verses.text: Hast thou heard the secret of God? and dost thou restrain wisdom to thyself?

similars.text: How hast thou counselled him that hath no wisdom? and how hast thou plentifully declared the thing as it is?
If not, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I shall teach thee wisdom.
Lord, thou hast heard the desire of the humble: thou wilt prepare their heart, thou wilt cause thine ear to hear:
But to be learned is good if they hearken unto the counsels of God.
And that he would shew thee the secrets of wisdom, that they are double to that which is! Know therefore that God exacteth of thee less than thine iniquity deserveth.
Lest thou learn his ways, and get a snare to thy soul.
Lest ye should say, We have found out wisdom: God thrusteth him down, not man.
But we speak the wisdom of God in a mystery, even the hidden wisdom, which God ordained before the world unto our glory:
So that thou incline thine ear unto wisdom, and apply thine heart to understanding;
Thou hast commanded us to keep thy precepts diligently.
So shall the knowledge of wisdom be unto thy soul: when thou hast found it, then there shall be a reward, and thy expectation shall not be cut off.
Hear counsel, and receive instruction, that thou mayest be wise in thy latter end.

verses.text: What knowest thou, that we know not? what understandest thou, which is not in us?

similars.text: How do ye know of their surety? Behold, ye cannot know of things which ye do not see; therefore ye cannot know that there shall be a Christ.
We are of God: he that knoweth God heareth us; he that is not of God heareth not us. Hereby know we the spirit of truth, and the spirit of error.

And the man said unto him: We do not believe that thou knowest any such thing. We do not believe in these foolish traditions. We do not believe that thou knowest of things to come, neither do we believe that thy fathers and also that our fathers did know concerning the things which they spake, of that which is to come.
And if thou say in thine heart, How shall we know the word which the Lord hath not spoken?
And they said unto me: We have not; for the Lord maketh no such thing known unto us.
But continue thou in the things which thou hast learned and hast been assured of, knowing of whom thou hast learned them;
Thomas saith unto him, Lord, we know not whither thou goest; and how can we know the way?

verses.text: With us are both the grayheaded and very aged men, much elder than thy father.
Are the consolations of God small with thee? is there any secret thing with thee?
Why doth thine heart carry thee away? and what do thy eyes wink at,

similars.text: Let them not depart from thine eyes; keep them in the midst of thine heart.

verses.text: That thou turnest thy spirit against God, and lettest such words go out of thy mouth?

similars.text: Your words have been stout against me, saith the Lord. Yet ye say, What have we spoken so much against thee?
Your words have been stout against me, saith the Lord. Yet ye say: What have we spoken against thee?
Thou givest thy mouth to evil, and thy tongue frameth deceit.

But behold, it is better that thy soul should be lost than that thou shouldst be the means of bringing many souls down to destruction, by thy lying and by thy flattering words; therefore if thou shalt deny again, behold God shall smite thee, that thou shalt become dumb, that thou shalt never open thy mouth any more, that thou shalt not deceive this people any more.
Now therefore, behold, the Lord hath put a lying spirit in the mouth of these thy prophets, and the Lord hath spoken evil against thee.
Behold, I am against the prophets, saith the Lord, that use their tongues, and say, He saith.
Thou art become cruel to me: with thy strong hand thou opposest thyself against me.
As yet exaltest thou thyself against my people, that thou wilt not let them go?
In transgressing and lying against the Lord, and departing away from our God, speaking oppression and revolt, conceiving and uttering from the heart words of falsehood.
And it speaketh harshly against sin, according to the plainness of the truth; wherefore, no man will be angry at the words which I have written save he shall be of the spirit of the devil.
And now, O Lord, wilt thou turn away thine anger, and try again if they will serve thee? And if so, O Lord, thou canst bless them according to thy words which thou hast said.
For they speak against thee wickedly, and thine enemies take thy name in vain.
Now therefore, behold, the Lord hath put a lying spirit in the mouth of all these thy prophets, and the Lord hath spoken evil concerning thee.
Thou renewest thy witnesses against me, and increasest thine indignation upon me; changes and war are against me.
Against whom do ye sport yourselves? against whom make ye a wide mouth, and draw out the tongue? are ye not children of transgression, a seed of falsehood,
Be not rash with thy mouth, and let not thine heart be hasty to utter any thing before God: for God is in heaven, and thou upon earth: therefore let thy words be few.
Also take no heed unto all words that are spoken; lest thou hear thy servant curse thee:
Thy voice shall be a rebuke unto the transgressor; and at thy rebuke let the tongue of the slanderer cease its perverseness.

verses.text: What is man, that he should be clean? and he which is born of a woman, that he should be righteous?

similars.text: How then can man be justified with God? or how can he be clean that is born of a woman?
How then can man be justified with God? or how can he be clean that is born of a woman?
How then can man be justified with God? or how can he be clean that is born of a woman?

verses.text: Behold, he putteth no trust in his saints; yea, the heavens are not clean in his sight.

similars.text: Behold, he put no trust in his servants; and his angels he charged with folly:
Behold even to the moon, and it shineth not; yea, the stars are not pure in his sight.

verses.text: How much more abominable and filthy is man, which drinketh iniquity like water?

similars.text: What man is like Job, who drinketh up scorning like water?

verses.text: I will shew thee, hear me; and that which I have seen I will declare;

similars.text: And the day cometh that you shall hear my voice and see me, and know that I am.
Hear, I beseech thee, and I will speak: I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto me.
Verily, verily, I say unto you, that my people shall know my name; yea, in that day they shall know that I am he that doth speak.
And behold, I, the Lord, declare unto you, and my words are sure and shall not fail, that they shall obtain it.
Behold, verily, verily, I say unto you, I will declare unto you my doctrine.
Therefore my people shall know my name: therefore they shall know in that day that I am he that doth speak: behold, it is I.
Behold, I, the Lord, utter my voice, and it shall be obeyed.
And this shall be a sign unto thee from the Lord, that the Lord will do this thing that he hath spoken;
Hear diligently my speech, and my declaration with your ears.
Give ear, O ye heavens, and I will speak; and hear, O earth, the words of my mouth.
And it shall come to pass in that day, I will hear, saith the Lord, I will hear the heavens, and they shall hear the earth;
And he that will hear my voice shall be my sheep; and him shall ye receive into the church, and him will I also receive.
I have called upon thee, for thou wilt hear me, O God: incline thine ear unto me, and hear my speech.
Behold, it is come, and it is done, saith the Lord God; this is the day whereof I have spoken.
Therefore, behold, I will this once cause them to know, I will cause them to know mine hand and my might; and they shall know that my name is The Lord.
Hear, O my people, and I will testify unto thee: O Israel, if thou wilt hearken unto me;
And who receiveth you receiveth me; and you shall have power to declare my word in the demonstration of my Holy Spirit.
I have declared my ways, and thou heardest me: teach me thy statutes.
Yea, verily I say unto you, in that day when the Lord shall come, he shall reveal all things--
Nevertheless hear thou now this word that I speak in thine ears, and in the ears of all the people;
And he said unto me: Awake, and hear the words which I shall tell thee; for behold, I am come to declare unto you the glad tidings of great joy.
I will declare the decree: the Lord hath said unto me, Thou art my Son; this day have I begotten thee.
Therefore, declare the things which ye have heard, and verily believe, and know to be true.
Also, saith the Lord; I the Lord, yea, I have spoken; yea, I have called him to declare, I have brought him, and he shall make his way prosperous.
And he said, Hear now my words: If there be a prophet among you, I the Lord will make myself known unto him in a vision, and will speak unto him in a dream.
Surely thou hast spoken in mine hearing, and I have heard the voice of thy words, saying,

For I am the Lord: I will speak, and the word that I shall speak shall come to pass; it shall be no more prolonged: for in your days, O rebellious house, will I say the word, and will perform it, saith the Lord God.
And the Lord said unto him: Believest thou the words which I shall speak?
Give ye ear, and hear my voice; hearken, and hear my speech.

And I will show it plainly as I showed it unto my disciples as I stood before them in the flesh, and spake unto them, saying: As ye have asked of me concerning the signs of my coming, in the day when I shall come in my glory in the clouds of heaven, to fulfil the promises that I have made unto your fathers,
And that which he hath seen and heard may be made known unto my disciples, that they perish not. And for this cause have I spoken these things.
Again I say unto you, hearken and hear and obey the law which I shall give unto you.
And I will establish my covenant with thee; and thou shalt know that I am the Lord:
And it shall come to pass, that whosoever will not hearken unto my words which he shall speak in my name, I will require it of him.
Yea, they shall know of a surety that these things are true, for from heaven will I declare it unto them.
Verily, verily, I say unto thee, We speak that we do know, and testify that we have seen; and ye receive not our witness.
And thou shalt speak my words unto them, whether they will hear, or whether they will forbear: for they are most rebellious.
Behold, I, the Lord, have spoken it.
And men shall speak of the might of thy terrible acts: and I will declare thy greatness.
And if my people will hearken unto my voice, and unto the voice of my servants whom I have appointed to lead my people, behold, verily I say unto you, they shall not be moved out of their place.
And now, my brethren, I would speak unto you more; but on the morrow I will declare unto you the remainder of my words. Amen.
He who hath faith to hear shall hear.
That I may make it manifest, as I ought to speak.
Hear, I beseech thee, and I will speak: I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto me.
Behold, verily, verily, I say unto you, I will declare unto you my doctrine.
I have declared my ways, and thou heardest me: teach me thy statutes.

verses.text: Which wise men have told from their fathers, and have not hid it:

similars.text: Which we have heard and known, and our fathers have told us.

verses.text: Unto whom alone the earth was given, and no stranger passed among them.
The wicked man travaileth with pain all his days, and the number of years is hidden to the oppressor.
A dreadful sound is in his ears: in prosperity the destroyer shall come upon him.
He believeth not that he shall return out of darkness, and he is waited for of the sword.

similars.text: He mocketh at fear, and is not affrighted; neither turneth he back from the sword.
He keepeth back his soul from the pit, and his life from perishing by the sword.

verses.text: He wandereth abroad for bread, saying, Where is it? he knoweth that the day of darkness is ready at his hand.
Trouble and anguish shall make him afraid; they shall prevail against him, as a king ready to the battle.

similars.text: His strength shall be hungerbitten, and destruction shall be ready at his side.

And he shall stir up his power and his courage against the king of the south with a great army; and the king of the south shall be stirred up to battle with a very great and mighty army; but he shall not stand: for they shall forecast devices against him.
The Lord shall go forth as a mighty man, he shall stir up jealousy like a man of war: he shall cry, yea, roar; he shall prevail against his enemies.

verses.text: For he stretcheth out his hand against God, and strengtheneth himself against the Almighty.

similars.text: He hath put forth his hands against such as be at peace with him: he hath broken his covenant.

Therefore is the anger of the Lord kindled against his people, and he hath stretched forth his hand against them, and hath smitten them: and the hills did tremble, and their carcases were torn in the midst of the streets. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.
As I live, saith the Lord God, surely with a mighty hand, and with a stretched out arm, and with fury poured out, will I rule over you:
For he addeth rebellion unto his sin, he clappeth his hands among us, and multiplieth his words against God.

Therefore, is the anger of the Lord kindled against his people, and he hath stretched forth his hand against them, and hath smitten them; and the hills did tremble, and their carcasses were torn in the midst of the streets. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.
And he said unto his men, The Lord forbid that I should do this thing unto my master, the Lord's anointed, to stretch forth mine hand against him, seeing he is the anointed of the Lord.
For the Lord of Hosts hath purposed, and who shall disannul? And his hand is stretched out, and who shall turn it back?

And it came to pass that the Lord said unto me: Stretch forth thine hand again unto thy brethren, and they shall not wither before thee, but I will shock them, saith the Lord, and this will I do, that they may know that I am the Lord their God.
With whom my hand shall be established: mine arm also shall strengthen him.
And say unto it, Thus saith the Lord God; Behold, O mount Seir, I am against thee, and I will stretch out mine hand against thee, and I will make thee most desolate.
And David said unto him, How wast thou not afraid to stretch forth thine hand to destroy the Lord's anointed?
For God shall cast upon him, and not spare: he would fain flee out of his hand.
Thou hast forsaken me, saith the Lord, thou art gone backward: therefore will I stretch out my hand against thee, and destroy thee; I am weary with repenting.
He is wise in heart, and mighty in strength: who hath hardened himself against him, and hath prospered?
And Moab shall be destroyed from being a people, because he hath magnified himself against the Lord.
The Lord forbid that I should stretch forth mine hand against the Lord's anointed: but, I pray thee, take thou now the spear that is at his bolster, and the cruse of water, and let us go.

Therefore thus saith the Lord God; I will also stretch out mine hand upon Edom, and will cut off man and beast from it; and I will make it desolate from Teman; and they of Dedan shall fall by the sword.
For the Lord of hosts hath purposed, and who shall disannul it? and his hand is stretched out, and who shall turn it back?

verses.text: He runneth upon him, even on his neck, upon the thick bosses of his bucklers:
Because he covereth his face with his fatness, and maketh collops of fat on his flanks.
And he dwelleth in desolate cities, and in houses which no man inhabiteth, which are ready to become heaps.

similars.text: Then said I: Lord, how long? And he said: Until the cities be wasted without inhabitant, and the houses without man, and the land be utterly desolate;
Then said I, Lord, how long? And he answered, Until the cities be wasted without inhabitant, and the houses without man, and the land be utterly desolate,
In mine ears, said the Lord of Hosts, of a truth many houses shall be desolate, and great and fair cities without inhabitant.
Her cities are a desolation, a dry land, and a wilderness, a land wherein no man dwelleth, neither doth any son of man pass thereby.

Thus saith the Lord of hosts; Again in this place, which is desolate without man and without beast, and in all the cities thereof, shall be an habitation of shepherds causing their flocks to lie down.
In mine ears said the Lord of hosts, Of a truth many houses shall be desolate, even great and fair, without inhabitant.
Her cities are a desolation, a dry land, and a wilderness, a land wherein no man dwelleth, neither doth any son of man pass thereby.

verses.text: He shall not be rich, neither shall his substance continue, neither shall he prolong the perfection thereof upon the earth.

similars.text: Thus saith the Lord, Let not the wise man glory in his wisdom, neither let the mighty man glory in his might, let not the rich man glory in his riches:
A man shall not be established by wickedness: but the root of the righteous shall not be moved.
He that loveth pleasure shall be a poor man: he that loveth wine and oil shall not be rich.
That which he laboured for shall he restore, and shall not swallow it down: according to his substance shall the restitution be, and he shall not rejoice therein.

verses.text: He shall not depart out of darkness; the flame shall dry up his branches, and by the breath of his mouth shall he go away.

similars.text: All darkness shall be hid in his secret places: a fire not blown shall consume him; it shall go ill with him that is left in his tabernacle.

And say to the forest of the south, Hear the word of the Lord; Thus saith the Lord God; Behold, I will kindle a fire in thee, and it shall devour every green tree in thee, and every dry tree: the flaming flame shall not be quenched, and all faces from the south to the north shall be burned therein.
His roots shall be dried up beneath, and above shall his branch be cut off.
Our God shall come, and shall not keep silence: a fire shall devour before him, and it shall be very tempestuous round about him.
Yea, the light of the wicked shall be put out, and the spark of his fire shall not shine.

Every thing that may abide the fire, ye shall make it go through the fire, and it shall be clean: nevertheless it shall be purified with the water of separation: and all that abideth not the fire ye shall make go through the water.
Out of his mouth go burning lamps, and sparks of fire leap out.
All darkness shall be hid in his secret places: a fire not blown shall consume him; it shall go ill with him that is left in his tabernacle.
The light shall be dark in his tabernacle, and his candle shall be put out with him.

verses.text: Let not him that is deceived trust in vanity: for vanity shall be his recompence.

similars.text: Let no man deceive himself. If any man among you seemeth to be wise in this world, let him become a fool, that he may be wise.
When thou with rebukes dost correct man for iniquity, thou makest his beauty to consume away like a moth: surely every man is vanity. Selah.
The Lord knoweth the thoughts of man, that they are vanity.
Blessed is that man that maketh the Lord his trust, and respecteth not the proud, nor such as turn aside to lies.

verses.text: It shall be accomplished before his time, and his branch shall not be green.
He shall shake off his unripe grape as the vine, and shall cast off his flower as the olive.

similars.text: Yet gleaning grapes shall be left in it, as the shaking of an olive tree, two or three berries in the top of the uppermost bough, four or five in the outmost fruitful branches thereof, saith the Lord God of Israel.

And it came to pass that the master of the vineyard saw it, and he said unto his servant: It grieveth me that I should lose this tree; wherefore, go and pluck the branches from a wild olive tree, and bring them hither unto me; and we will pluck off those main branches which are beginning to wither away, and we will cast them into the fire that they may be burned.

verses.text: For the congregation of hypocrites shall be desolate, and fire shall consume the tabernacles of bribery.

similars.text: Therefore, as the fire devoureth the stubble, and the flame consumeth the chaff, their root shall be rottenness, and their blossoms shall go up as dust; because they have cast away the law of the Lord of Hosts, and despised the word of the Holy One of Israel.

Therefore as the fire devoureth the stubble, and the flame consumeth the chaff, so their root shall be as rottenness, and their blossom shall go up as dust: because they have cast away the law of the Lord of hosts, and despised the word of the Holy One of Israel.

Thou hast defiled thy sanctuaries by the multitude of thine iniquities, by the iniquity of thy traffick; therefore will I bring forth a fire from the midst of thee, it shall devour thee, and I will bring thee to ashes upon the earth in the sight of all them that behold thee.
But the wicked shall perish, and the enemies of the Lord shall be as the fat of lambs: they shall consume; into smoke shall they consume away.

verses.text: They conceive mischief, and bring forth vanity, and their belly prepareth deceit.

similars.text: None calleth for justice, nor any pleadeth for truth: they trust in vanity, and speak lies; they conceive mischief, and bring forth iniquity.
Whiles they see vanity unto thee, whiles they divine a lie unto thee, to bring thee upon the necks of them that are slain, of the wicked, whose day is come, when their iniquity shall have an end.
None calleth for justice, nor any pleadeth for truth: they trust in vanity, and speak lies; they conceive mischief, and bring forth iniquity.
Behold, he travaileth with iniquity, and hath conceived mischief, and brought forth falsehood.
